turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about G.H. Bass & Co..
turn.1: What happened to G.H. Bass & Co. in 1928?
turn.2: In 1928, the firm sued Abbott Co. for infringement of patent for Overlap Seam and trademark of the “Quail Hunter” and “Ike Walton” styles, but lost the suit; in 1929, Bass bought Abbott Co., in order to reacquire exclusive rights to the overlap seam and Ike Walton, “Sportocasin” (Moccasins with spiked soles, golf shoes).
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: During 1928 through 1938 Admiral Richard E. Byrd wore Bass ski boots during the First, Second and Third Antarctic Expedition.
turn.6: In 1931 the firm opened an office in N.Y. on the 25th floor of 11 West 42nd Street New York, N.Y. in The Salmon Tower Building.
turn.10: Four years later, in 1940 the original suede “Buc” style is created.
turn.12: In 1948, the firm outfitted the American Olympic Team with footwear.
